text:
Hello everyone,

I'm looking for help with gathering information. Is it possible to compile a list of all form names along with their corresponding form submission email addresses? Essentially, I'm looking to identify who receives the submissions after a form is submitted.

Your help with this would be greatly appreciated!
<@U05R380MLMC> hope you don't mind the tag - just bumping to your attention, really would be great to figure out the issue here

Hi Everyone,

I need one help I am running API on HubSpot using javascript inside module and it is throwing CORS error.Please help me on this is it possible to call the API in javascript in module direclty ?

This got past me!  Thanks for the mention.
 The one thing that stands out is that you are using v2 API endpoint.  Have you tried with the v3 endpoint?
Can you paste your entire response from your API call?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/blog-post|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/blog-post>
Getting lots of bad gateway errors on the API in the past 10 minutes, anyone else?
login servers are down for me
me too
<https://status.HubSpot.com/> now says Major Outage
Our team is on it, our status page is the best place to stay updated ^ <https://status.HubSpot.com/>

Hello everyone! I have a question about the contacts API. When using the "Update contact" endpoint (batch or single) and using email as the unique identifier, does it take into account secondary emails when looking for contacts to update? Or does it only take into account primary emails?
Can confirm this works.
Sorry, are you confirming secondary emails are taken into account or not?
Yeah it is possible to update a contact by using the secondary email as the identifier when using idProperty=email
great! is that true for all versions of the api?
I would assume so. But personally I have used only the v3 APIs
gotcha. thanks for the help!
Thanks to <@U058ZPH175H> for the help! Follow up questions for everyone, they were able to confirm that secondary emails are taken into account for v3 of the API. Can anyone else confirm v1? v2?
*HubSpot is fully recovered.* We will update the Incident thread when we have more information on what happened. <https://status.HubSpot.com/incidents/590gy6mpxjhk>
Hello all, for the Batch update companies, how many companies can i list at the same time?

There is a limit that’s enforced when making a batch read request that includes the propertiesWithHistory parameter - but I’ve forgotten what it is exactly.

Is it the amount of records that can be read in a single request that’s limited when including this parameter?

And/or is there a cap to the amount of properties you can retrieve history for within a single request?

Anyone recall? '

Hi <@U05CAJG8D98> - I believe you can get the "hs_meeting_change_id" property value and then build the link accordingly using it as either the rescheduleId or cancelId query parameter for the meeting link that it was created from.

Sorry I'm late to the party here, but the `hs_created_by` property refers to a HubSpot user's userId, whereas `HubSpot_owner_id` refers to the internal value for that HubSpot user in any property that is a HubSpot user type property. However, neither of those values will refer at all to the contact(s) that the meeting is associated with.

In other words, every HubSpot user in your portal has two IDs that can be referenced in the API:
• userId
• ownerId
The easiest way to find the ownerId for a user is to go into an existing user property (like Contact Owner) and reference the internal values. The easiest way to find the userId is to go into editing a user in Settings and it will be the id in the URL.
<@U063D0GCSHF> I have been wanting to be able to somehow retrieve newly created Marketing Campaigns so we can keep some external logs of them.

I remember encountering the special pagination limit with propertiesWithHistory parameter when using the Batch Read request for the Contacts object.
It returns a maximum of 50 contacts per paginated request.
Excluding the propertiesWithHistory param restores the paginated collection size to 100.

Haven't explored if there is a cap on the amount of properties or the number of historical entries for each property.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/understanding-the-crm#:~:text=Batch%20endpoints%20have%20a%20limit%20of%20100%20records%20per%20call|100 per this doc>.
